summary: PCV3 was found positive in 67.1% of the 283 clinical samples taken from 2014 to 2017 as shown by qPCR. single infection with PCV3 accounted for only one-third of the samples. KSI (95% of the strains), while the other two groups did not have such a ‘signature’ pattern. PCV3 might have emerged in pigs and could spread by fecal shedding. online version of this article contains electronic supplementary material.
